titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Roland Tasho photographs
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Beaudry Rae Allen

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-04-08T14:58-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Photographs depicting the social and political conditions in Albania from the Communist era to 2000 and the Kosovo refugee crisis in 1999.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Roland Tasho photographs, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2000.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographs that detail the socio-political climate of Albania from the 1960s to 2000. Photographs include themes of education, agriculture, industry, religion, and politics. The collection mainly focuses on the political turmoil of the 1990s from the fall of Communism, the 1996 disputed elections, the Albanian Unrest of 1997 ( Rebelimi i vitit 1997), demonstrations after the assassination of Albanian member of parliament Azem Hajdari, and the Kosovo refugee crisis in 1999.
The collection maintains the original titles given by the creator. The photographs are organized chronologically and related subjects are grouped together.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of everyday life in Albania including people, towns, seasons, work, technology, industry, and leisure activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of people and village life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes black and white images of family life, education, agriculture, factory work, military, and entertainment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes reprints of photographs of Enver Hoxha as a partisan leader in the 1940s (not taken by the creator).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of classroom activities, a field trip to the Lenin-Stalin Museum, and student volunteer work building apartments and the Progozina-Fier railway.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of mining and factory work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of a ballet, music recitals, and plays.

National Library at the University of Tirana,
Children’s program at Albanian State TV,
Drawing of Heroes of Socialist Realism,
Monument of National Hero Scanderbeg, includes views of Tirana, Apollonia (Fier), and Butrint (Saranda),
Visits to Enver Hoxha's house in Gjirdkastra,
President Ramiz Alia and Prime Minister Adil Garçani,
Glass mill and carpet factory, Kavaja, 1984
Clothes factory in Korça and Shkodra,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of people, industry, body-building, and buildings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of Mother Teresa's visit in 1991 and the Pope John Paul II visit in 1992.

did.unittitle: Tombs of Mother Teresa's mother and sister,
Holy Site of “Shna Ndov” (Saint Andrew), Laç, Albania,
The Foundation of the First Opposition Party,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Partia Demokratike e Shqipërisë leaders: Neritan Ceka, Sali Berisha, Arben Imami, Gramoz Pashko, Eduard Selami, and Aleksandër Meksi.

Demonstrations to overthrow the Socialist government,
Students celebrate by burning the posters of Enver Hoxha and Ramiz Tafë Alia,

Free passing at the border with Greece, Kakavijë, Albania,
Burning a statue of dictator Enver Hoxha, Tirana Main Square,
The opening of the Coca Cola factory, 1994
Bomb explosion in front of pyramid [scheme] company VEFA supermarket,
Opposition protests after the manipulated elections,
Democratic Party campaign rallies and celebrations,
Hunger strike of the Democratic Alliance Party and the Social-Democratic Party after elections,
State violence against Opposition leaders, Tirana Main Square,
Beating of a journalist and burning of the offices of the Koha Jone newspaper,
Funeral of a murdered Democratic Party member,
Older communists celebrating Enver Hoxha's birthday,
"Throne-Pretender" Leka Zogu, campaign to restore monarchy rule in Albania,
Village life in Tirana, Lezhë, and Durrës,

Location of MP Azem Hajdari's murder,

Removal of Yugoslav flag from the Yugoslav Embassy,
Opposition rally following the election of Fatos Nano,
Resignation of Prime Minister Pandeli Majko and appointment of Prime Minister Ilir Meta,
Construction and new restaurants in Durrës and Tirana,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of camp life, food distribution, and official delegation visits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of the Albanian civil defence authorities and the Greek government, who set up the camp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of "SOS Kosova" TV program, camp life, and refugee transfers and departures back to Kosovo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of camp life, Greek military food distribution, and local politician's visit.

did.unittitle: Demonstrations at the Yugoslav Embassy, Tirana,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of Paskal Milo, Adem Demaçi, Ibrahim Rugova, Rexhep Qosja, and investment banker George Soros.

did.unittitle: Kosovar refugees in a nursing home for the old, Tirana,
Tony Blair's visit to Tirana, Albania,
Exhibition of paintings by Kosovar children, Tirana,
Homeless Kosovar refugees who remained in Durrës,
Volunteers at Albanian Center for Human Rights offering services and recreation activities to Kosovar children,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Over 180 photographs that focus on post-Kosovo war daily life. Includes images of people, buildings, the National Library, graveyards, politicians, and the remaining destruction from the 1999 crisis.
